noun.description: Correct, approved, or traditional use of language; (formerly also) the branch of grammar which deals this. Now rare.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in Martin Fotherby (c1560–1620), bishop of Salisbury. From ancient Greek ὀρθολογία correctness of language from ὀρθο- ortho- + -λογία -logy<br>1970s; earliest use found in Systematic Zoology. From ortho- + -logy, after orthologous.
